text: There ’ s a video on the internet of Ed Sheeran, before he was famous, playing to bemused passers - by in London ’ s St Pancras station. He was more fresh - faced and less bearded, but was already purveying his now ubiquitous, one - size - fits - all mix of folk, soul, rap and bantz, urging the railway passengers to sing along and “ make a circle ”. In a staggeringly ironic comment to camera, he says : “ My music doesn ’ t really hit everyone, otherwise I ’ d be a lucky man. ” Eight years later, he is that lucky man – and then some – and the only real change is the size of the audience. A total of 200, 000 people will see the creator of the fastest -
